intro: Pityrophyllum erubescens, commonly known as the red sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Pityrophyllum erubescens is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats.
